intro: Podolepis capillaris, commonly known as the slender podolepis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its narrow, grass-like leaves are arranged in a rosette pattern, and it produces numerous small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Podolepis capillaris is often found in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
